page.title: 02Churches and Chapels
page.content: St.Nicholas Church,Brushford, the only church in the survey area,is a beautiful 13 century building. A chapel designed by Sir Edward Lutyens was added in 1924 in memory of Aubrey Herbert of Pixton Park (the man who was Greenmantle). Brushford is now a United Benefice with Dulverton,with one service each Sunday and congregations of 25_30. 100 colourful hassocks,embroidered by ladies of the parish and friends, were begun during Jubilee Year,1977. Local legend inaccurately credits an ancient oak tree in the church yard with being mentioned in the 1086 Domesday Book.It recently underwent surgery to render it safe and prolong its life. Methodists and Roman Catholics have Chapels in Dulverton.
